runs.comm: back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man and the fielder slips, parries the ball and it runs into the rope, unfortunate but goes to show how dewy it is out there
tighter line and blocked back up the wicket
steps inside the line and tries to flick a back of a length ball to leg, comes off the pad via the glove to long leg
well, short and wide but Hales just hangs the bat outside off and it flies away, sails over point for four, amazing timing
and Hales find the wide third man with guided stroke of the back foot, opening the face, a fumble allows two
too wide of off stump
back of a length, little bit of nip in, catches the thigh pad
short and straight, Lumb is a little unsure hooking and misses by a long way
short again, hooked again and this takes a top edge and flies quite fine, one bounce
another short one, another hook and this time he gets more bat on it and it flies uncontrolled again but all the way this time, over long on it went
full outside off but Lumb goes back and plays towards mid off
short again and hooked again, gets this high on the bat towards long leg, the fielder can't get there in time and they charge back for the second
push forward just outside off, gets a thick outside edge to third man
length off the pad towards square leg as Lumb tried to flick it away
push forward just outside off to a good length ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad, runs towards point and there's a quick single
goes to flick to leg again and doesn't get it and the ball runs short into the leg side
back of a length ball, pulled straight to the man in the deep and dropped a dreadful, dreadful drop, did not have to move, two hands at shoulder height and the ball slips to earth
back of a length and picked up well over midwicket, didn't get all of it but enough to cow corner
length down leg now
full length, swing into the pads and runs towards gully, if he were there
gets away with a half-tracker from around the wicket that's pulled down to deep backward square, missed out
length on leg stump, flicked through square leg and they come back for a very sharp second
back of a length around off stump, pushed to mid on
back on his stumps, again pushed into midwicket and again they run hard and come back for two, the throw was a touch wide and that was crucial
waited for and chopped in front of short third man
played from off stump towards cover point, Hales was after a single that was never there and Lumb was spot on to send him back
full and just outside off, Lumb gets a bat on it and it races to fine third man
just outside off, chopped towards cover point
full and outside off, driven past mid off, this is timed much better than I thought and it races to the rope, good shot
length ball moves away from this tentative prod outside off, well bowled
length ball nips in this time and catches the pad too high for the lbw appeal, runs square on the off side
pressed into the covers, a misfield but it doesn't cost a run
skip down and a clip over the top, timed well and enough on it to get it over long off
leg stump and clipped past square leg
slog swept off middle and off, gets it wide of deep square for a one-bounce four, very well placed, did well to get it there
steps to leg and gets in a right mess, ends up turned it in the air to midwicket but the fielder can't come to his left quick enough and fails with a dive
turned to square leg but the 45 is up quickly to field and prevent the single
wanted to go down the wicket, in the end waited and drove hard to a full ball outside off, nearly got it through but cover slid and saved well
over the wicket, leg stump, no turn, runs off the pad to the 45
outside off, back in the crease and cut through point, the sweeper comes round
floated up on middle and off, pushed into the covers
forward press from off stump to mid off
length on leg stump, skids on, runs off the pad to the 45 on the off side
off stump, timed nicely down the ground and a comfortable couple as long off can't get to his left in time
down the wicket and picked up very well wide of long on, that was stroked very nicely
flicked from off stump into midwicket
driven at outside off, takes a thin edge, no chance for Dhoni and this races away to third man
just covering up on off stump now
tried to come down, Ashwin fired it in and Lumb had to adjust and block up the wicket
waited for in the crease and cut at, misses
just outside off, pushed in front of point on the front foot

down the wicket, swing and miss and easily stumped Yuvraj has slipped on past Lumb and India have their breakthrough. Lumb tried to leg side against the spin but this ball is just skidding on with the dew, Lumb was late on the stroke and missed by a distance, smart but simply stumping for Dhoni
floated up on off stump, careful forward press in defence
off stump, again forward to block carefully, tried to move it into a gap on the off side but couldn't
down to paddle sweep and probably gets too much on this so deep square leg can get in and keep it down to a single
leg stump, pushed to midwicket
short and wide and gets away with it, Wright can only slap down to long off
and now a full toss outside off, gets it past extra cover, this time the poor ball is punished but that was a very weak effort at extra cover
off stump, back and pushed out to deep cover
tossed up just outside off, slapped down to long off on the floor
back to meet a ball that skidded on, forces it away towards cover point
down the track and a slightly ugly slap in the end, off the inner half of the bat into midwicket
full toss outside off, larruped low on the bounce straight to extra-cover
Yuvraj strangles a shout as the ball slides on with the arm, Wright advances and gets a bit of bat alongside his pad in front of the stumps
drags his length down as Wright dances forward, it turns into a can-can, kicking the ball towards point with bat tucked behind pad
tossed up and swept hard, it goes straight at Dinda, who nearly falls over trying to field, causing a look of consternation to flash across Yuvraj's face
pushed through outside off stump, goes back and times a late cut behind point for a couple

again this skids on to Wright's front pad and this time the finger goes up! He had come forward, was bang in line with off stump as the ball thumped pad, played down the wrong line and that looked like it would have gone to clip the top of middle
tossed up, worked through the leg side with a closed bat face
tossed up and spinning away, scooped over the infield to the cover sweeper on the bounce
little short of a length, pulled flat through midwicket for another single
floated up, Morgan switches the hands straight away and drags it fine past short third man, it races to the boundary
full and outside the line of off, dropped into the covers for one
comes down the pitched, drops short and it deflects behind square off the pad
full and slipping down the leg side, clips the pad and skids behind square
flat, pushed across a bit quicker, chopped through point with an angled blade outside off
touch short, straightening, Hales goes back but picks out cover-point with his cut
drops short again, pulled flat through square leg, Dinda goes full length and crowd-surfs across the path of the ball to prevent four
tossed up and swept flat to deep backward square this time
full and bunged down the leg side, shovelled in the air through the 45 to the man in the deep
full, misdirected down the leg side and Morgan helps himself, swiping hard with a horizontal bat for four to long leg
tossed up on the stumps, worked through midwicket
more dross from Chawla, a full toss, looked like an offbreak out of the hand, Hales clumps it flat through extra-cover in front of the sweeper for four more
on the stumps, steers it through point for a single
the googly from Chawla and it grips just enough to spin past Morgan's outside edge as he played down the Bakerloo
tossed up and bunged down the ground for a single to long-on
touch short, on the stumps, crouches low and pulls one through mid-on
flipped off the pads through midwicket
tossed up outside the line of off stump, Morgan flashes a square drive through the infield to the man on the fence

Yuvraj strikes again, Hales picking out deep backward square with a slog-sweep! Dinda took the catch tumbling back as the ball dropped towards him, the connection was decent but not enough to carry over the rope and Yuvraj stands, arms spread, drinking in the pandemonium
tossed up down the leg side, heaved mightily through square, that skips away for four more to Morgan, who's beginning to purr
drags this down as Morgan advances, he has to improvise to pat the ball towards point, like playing a tennis smash, but can't beat the fielder

flipped into the leg side and dropped by Chawla running round at deep square leg, Patel played a short ball from deep in the crease, came off the bottom of the bat as he tried to flick to leg, it looped through CHawla's hands plunged forward, would have - should have - been a good catch
beats Morgan's attempted dab outside off stump
pitched up in the channel and punched through point
dug in short of a length, Patel jabs the ball to cover off the back foot - another dot ball
goes back and pulls through vacant mid-on, in the air but lands safely but just a single the damage
Morgan is the joker in this situation and he murders this over extra-cover, a desperately needed boundary for his side
looped up wide of off stump and slapped over extra-cover, he's picked the gap as it bisects long-off and the cover sweeper
tighter line, length ball outside off, chopped straight to cover-point
floated up and driven down the ground to long-on
fired across, full and flat towards Morgan's off stump, can't get under it and pushes just one to long-off
quicker legbreak slides on outside off, Patel swipes and misses
tossed up, wide of the stumps, Patel frees the arms but this time his drive finds wide long-off for another single
short of a length and outside the line of off, Patel happy to steer one to third man and get Morgan on strike
short and wide, Morgan throws the bat at this and uses the pace to steer it over backward point, it beats the fielder and that's four
length ball, on the body, Morgan works it past midwicket for a couple
dug in and pushed across, played on the back foot into the ground for a single down to long-off

Patel gets under it, this hasn't got the legs and drops safely into Gambhir's mitts at midwicket! There was a bit too much on it for Patel to pull cleanly, the ball came off the splice and looped gently up towards the edge of the circle
length ball and that's a home run, Morgan baseball-batting the ball flat over deep midwicket! A trademark power slog across the line and it keeps England in the hunt
banged in short, at the man, played on the back foot short on the off side and they hustle a single to get Morgan back on strike
length ball, again it's in Morgan's slot but he doesn't get hold of this one and pulls flat to deep midwicket, no chance of a second either
full and wide, Buttler had stepped away but that's thumped low through extra-cover, such power from Buttler, using his wrists to drill the ball through the infield even though he wasn't well placed
short this time, steps back and pulls through mid-on, doesn't connect cleanly
pitched up outside off, drilled back past the bowler and mid-off does terrifically to stop it and keep them to one
oh, that's corked it, Buttler shifts back in the crease and mullers a length ball straight back down the ground, it goes flat and hard and all the way!
full and outside off, Morgan clears his front foot but can only shovel it towards long-on for a single
fullish, outside the line of off, Buttler elects to go back again and thrash the ball out towards long-off for another single
leg-stump line, slightly full and Morgan hits across the line, the ball flies flat towards deep midwicket
full and wide, Buttler shuffles across and tries the ramp, he gets it away fine off the toe but R Ashwin scuttles round to cut it off at third man, just two the damage
full and very wide, again he goes right across, misses with the scoop but Morgan has already set off and Dhoni's throw misses!

and Morgan smashes it straight back over Dinda's head for six! You can't set a field for that! It was full, searching for the yorker, but ended up being a half volley in Morgan's hitting arc and he made no mistake, kabooming the ball over the rope with a free-flowing swing of the arms - and that means England win by six wickets to tie the T20 series 1-1
